content.text: The echo command is used to show a line of text or a variable's value in the terminal.
content.html: The echo command is used to show a line of text or a variable's value in the terminal.

content.text: To display a simple message, use echo "message" :
content.html: To display a simple message, use echo "message":

content.code_html:
echo "Hello, World!"
Hello, World!

content.text: The echo command has several options to customize its output:
content.html: The echo command has several options to customize its output:

content.text: The -n option prevents echo from adding a newline at the end of the output.
content.html: The -n option prevents echo from adding a newline at the end of the output.

content.text: This is useful when you want to continue output on the same line.
content.html: This is useful when you want to continue output on the same line.

content.code_html:
echo -n "Hello,";echo " World!"
Hello, World!

content.text: The -e option enables the use of backslash escapes like \ n for new lines, \ t for tabs, etc.
content.html: The -e option enables the use of backslash escapes like \n for new lines, \t for tabs, etc.

content.text: This allows for more formatted output.

content.code_html:
echo -e "Hello\nWorld!"
Hello
World!

content.text: The -E option disables the use of backslash escapes, which is the default behavior.
content.html: The -E option disables the use of backslash escapes, which is the default behavior.

content.text: This ensures that the text is output exactly as typed.
content.html: This ensures that the text is output exactly as typed.

content.code_html:
echo -E "Hello\nWorld!"
Hello\nWorld!

content.text: The echo command is often used in scripts for debugging or logging information. It helps you see what's happening in your script by printing messages to the terminal.
content.html: The echo command is often used in scripts for debugging or logging information. It helps you see what's happening in your script by printing messages to the terminal.

content.code:
#!/bin/bash


echo

"Starting the script..."


# Your script commands here


echo

"Script finished."
content.code_html:

echo "Starting the script..."
